page.title: 08ANCILLARY UNITS (c)
page.content: {The Hip Joint Replacement Unit}was established in 1969 under the direction of Professor Sir John Charnley. It is served by five Consultant Orthopaedic Surgeons who attend the hospital frequently, and more than 300 patients from all parts of the world are admitted each year for hip replacements. One of the four operating theatres has been equipped with a{Charnley-Howorth {"Clean Air" Enclosure}which provides a laminar flow of purified air. Inside, the operating team wear special operating clothing from which body- exhausts are extracted by a special unit providing additional precaution against infection, the most common cause of post-operative failure in orthopaedic surgery.
